# zb (Zero Dependencies Builder)

> A lightweight Java build tool that compiles Java source code and generates executable JARs with zero external dependencies.

## Installation

```bash
git clone https://github.com/AdamBien/zb.git
cd zb
mvn clean package
cp target/zb.jar src/main/sh/zb.sh ~/bin/
chmod +x ~/bin/zb.sh
```

## Usage

Run from project root:

```bash
zb.sh
```

Or with explicit paths:

```bash
java -jar zb.jar [sources] [classes] [jar_dir] [jar_file]
```

## Configuration

Create `.zb` in project root (auto-generated on first run):

```properties
sources.dir=<discovered by zb>
resources.dir=<discovered by zb>
classes.dir=<temp.dir>
jar.dir=zbo/
jar.file.name=app.jar
```

## When to Use zb

- Java 21+ projects without external dependencies
- Single-module applications with `void main()` entry point
- Quick prototyping without Maven/Gradle overhead

## Output

Executable JAR in `zbo/app.jar` (default) with auto-detected main class.
